# Draft:Battle Of Burekiwe

----
The Battle Of Burekiwe (also spelled Birikiwe or Bureikiwe) was fought around 1898 between the Azande Kingdom under King Gbudwe Bazingbi and a Mahdist army led by Arabi Dafalla. It took place near Burekiwe (present-day Yambio, South Sudan).
Aftermath
The defeat at Burekiwe weakened Mahdist control in the region and bolstered Azande independence. However, the respite was short-lived. Later in 1898, the Mahdist State collapsed following the Anglo-Egyptian victory at the Battle of Omdurman.
In the early 20th century, Azande lands became contested by European colonial powers Britain, Belgium, and France. King Gbudwe continued to resist foreign domination until his defeat at the Battle of Yambio in 1905, after which he died in captivity.
